decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The development to which this permission relates must be begun not later than the expiration of 5 years, beginning with the date of this permission.  Reason for condition: To comply with Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990.

Condition : 2 - The garage(s) and/or car parking space(s) shown on the approved drawing no WS59701B shall be provided before commencement of the use of the land or building(s) hereby permitted and thereafter shall be kept free from obstruction and shall not be used for purposes other than the parking of vehicles in conjunction with the development hereby permitted.  Reason for condition: To ensure the provision of adequate off-street parking in order to prevent additional parking in surrounding streets which could be detrimental to amenity and prejudicial to highway safety.

Condition : 3 - No demolition or construction work in pursuance of this permission shall be carried on before 0800 or after 1800 on Mondays to Fridays inclusive, before 0800 or after 1300 on Saturdays, and at any time on Sundays or Bank Holidays.  Reason for condition: To safeguard the amenities of the occupiers of adjoining residential properties.

Condition : 4 - Details of the materials to be used for the external surfaces of the building/extension shall be submitted to and approved by the local Planning Authority before any work is commenced.  Reason for condition: To ensure a satisfactory appearance for the development.

Condition : 5 - Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning General Development Order 1988 (or any Order revoking or re-enacting this Order) no buildings, extensions or alterations permitted by Classes A,B,C and E of Part 1 of the 2nd Schedule of the 1988 Order shall be carried out without the prior permission of the Local Planning Authority.  Reason for condition: To prevent an overdevelopment, having regard to the restricted nature of the site.

Condition : 6 - The open area around the building(s) as shown on drawing no. WS59701B shall be permanently retained as an amenity space for the occupants of the residential units hereby permitted and shall not be used for any other purpose.  Reason for condition: To ensure provision of adequate amenity space and to protect the amenities of adjoining residents.

Condition : 7 - The garage(s) hereby permitted shall not be used other than for the parking of private motor vehicles and no trade or business shall be carried out therefrom.  Reason for condition: To retain adequate off-street parking facilities.

Condition : 8 - Before any part of the development hereby permitted is first occupied a means of enclosure of a height and type to be approved by the Local Planning Authority shall be erected along the boundaries of the site and shall be permanently maintained thereafter.  Reason for condition: To ensure a satisfactory appearance for the development.

Condition : 9 - Before the building is first used the measures for access for disabled persons shown on drawing no. WS59701B shall be implemented to the satisfaction of the Local Planning Authority and shall be permanently maintained thereafter.  Reason for condition: To ensure that there is adequate access to the building for disabled persons.

Condition : 10 - All new tree, shrub and ground cover planting shall be carried out during the first planting season after the completion of building operations on the site or within such longer period as may be agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority, and such planting shall be maintained, including the replacement of dead, dying or defective plants and trees, to the satisfaction of the Local Planning Authority for a period of three years unless otherwise agreed.  Reason for condition: To preserve and maintain the visual amenities and character of the locality.

Condition : 11 - A tree planting/landscaping scheme which includes full details of species, size of plants and spacing shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for approval and be implemented during the next planting season after the completion of building operations on the site, or within any such longer period as may be agreed in writing with the Local Planning Authority. The Council will require a maintenance period of three years during which dead, dying or defective trees, shrubs and ground cover must be replaced.  Reason for condition: To enhance and maintain the visual amenities and character of the locality.

Condition : 12 - Details of works to be carried out to address any contamination problems (particularly soil samples and bore holes details) shall be agreed in writing with the Local Planning Authority before works commence on site and must be completed to the satisfaction of the same prior to the occupation of the development.  Reason for condition: To safeguard public health.
Condition : 13 - All works traffic shall access to and from South Park Road and York Road only.  Reason for condition: To protect pedestrian and vehicular safety.

Condition : 14 - Details of slab levels of the proposed buildings and existing site levels shall be previously submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any work commences and the development shall be completed in accordance with the approved levels.  Reason for condition: To ensure a satisfactory form of development having regard to change in existing land levels on the site.

Condition : 15 - Prior to the commencement of development on site, suitable apparatus of the type to be used for the cleaning and washing of works traffic shall be positioned at the entrance to the site leading on to South Park Road.  Reason for condition: To protect neighbouring amenity.

Condition : 16 - Details of a street lighting scheme shall be agreed in writing with the Local Planning Authority and implemented prior to occupation of the development.  Reason for condition: To safeguard amenities of residents.
description: ERECTION OF 9 TWO BEDROOM AND 14 THREE BEDROOM DETACHED, SEMI-DETACHED AND TERRACED HOUSES WITH PROVISION FOR ASSOCIATED CAR PARKING AND ESTATE ROAD, INVOLVING DEMOLITION OF ALL EXISTING BUILDINGS ON SITE.
